meanings.definition: The art or skill of mounting or presenting plays or other stage performances.
meanings.sent1: Her stagecraft was evident in the way she directed the actors and designed the set.
meanings.sent2: The theater students learned about stagecraft through hands-on experience in building sets.
meanings.sent3: The magician's stagecraft was so good that the audience believed he could make things disappear for real.
meanings.sent4: His stagecraft was like a well-choreographed dance, each movement perfectly timed and executed.
meanings.sent5: The stagecraft of the play transported the audience to a different world, full of magic and wonder.

meanings.definition: The techniques and methods used in creating and producing theatrical productions.
meanings.sent1: Learning about stagecraft involves understanding lighting, sound, and set design.
meanings.sent2: The director's attention to stagecraft details ensured a seamless and professional production.
meanings.sent3: The stagecraft of the play was so impressive that even the backstage crew couldn't help but applaud.
meanings.sent4: Her stagecraft was like a carefully crafted puzzle, each piece fitting perfectly to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The stagecraft of the musical was so intricate that every scene felt like a work of art come to life.
